title: Investment Knowledge Survey
description: Assess your current experience and knowledge about investing

questions.question: How would you describe your understanding of investing?
Which of these have you heard about before? (Choose all that apply)
options: Stocks (owning a small part of a company)
Bonds (lending money to a company or government)
Funds (a group of many investments put together)

questions.question: Have you ever invested money before?
What do you think is the main difference between saving and investing?
options: Saving means keeping your money for later, investing means trying to grow your money.

questions.question: What stops you from investing right now?
What do you want to learn most about investing?
Why might someone choose to invest?
options: To grow their money over time

questions.question: How comfortable are you with taking risks? (1 = not comfortable at all, 5 = very comfortable)
What worries you the most about investing?
options: I don’t know how to start
I think it costs too much money

questions.question: What is your primary investment goal?
options: To have more money in the future
Saving for something big (car, house, travel)
